intro: Mahafalia, commonly known as the Madagascar star jasmine, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, star-shaped white flowers. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are typically opposite in arrangement. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Mahafalia is also used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
